thread.title: Klingenschmitt's accusation adds to feud with Colorado Springs Senate candidate
thread.title_full: Klingenschmitt's accusation adds to feud with Colorado Springs Senate candidate - The Denver Post

author: denverpost
title: Klingenschmitt's accusation adds to feud with Colorado Springs Senate candidate
text:
Colorado Springs police are investigating a possible political theft.
Rep. Gordon Klingenschmitt accused former state Rep. Larry Liston of stealing a stack of political fliers from a table he had set up at a Pikes Peak Firearms Coalition meeting last week.
"He's a thief and a liar," Klingenschmitt said.
Liston said he took five fliers.
"Gordon is paranoid and delusional," Liston said.
Police are looking into the matter after Klingenschmitt filed a police report on Saturday.
Klingenschmitt is running for State Senate District 12 against Bob Gardner, a Colorado Springs attorney and former state representative. Liston and Gardner are friends, but Liston said he's not working on Gardner's campaign. All three are Republicans.
The fliers in question were double-sided printouts depicting Gardner's voting record.
"It's filled with half-truths, lies and innuendos," Liston said.
Read more at The Colorado Springs Gazette .
